subject: Business
title: Herding: Following the Crowd
description: A quick, practical guide to Herding: Following the Crowd.

hook.text: A restaurant has a line out the door. The one next door is empty. You join the line without checking the menu.

buildup.text: Herding means copying what others do, especially when we're uncertain about the right choice.

discovery.text: Information cascades explain it: if enough people choose A, latecomers assume A must be right.

twist.text: Herding can be rational individually but catastrophic collectively â€” like a stock market bubble.

climax.text: Everyone bought real estate in 2006 because everyone else was. The herd ran off a cliff together.

quiz.question: What triggers herding behavior?
options: Uncertainty makes us copy others' choices
Crowds are usually right about everything
